intro: Euchaetis elsieae, commonly known as the Elsie's euchaetis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and requires a cool, moist environment to thrive. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Euchaetis elsieae is considered a species of conservation concern.
